data.title: Can't build on Windows with the macos-bundle
data.body:
First problem : it links only against w2_32, opengl32... but not wxwidgets libs. It seems that

```
set(wxWidgets_LIBRARIES "${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_xrc.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_stc.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_richtext.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_propgrid.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_ribbon.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_aui.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_adv.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_html.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxmsw30u_core.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxbase30u_xml.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxbase30u_net.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxexpat.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxbase30u.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxpng.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxjpeg.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxzlib.a ${wxwidgets_lib_dir}/libwxtiff.a" PARENT_SCOPE)
        set(wxWidgets_LIBRARIES "${wxWidgets_LIBRARIES} ws2_32 user32 opengl32 glu32" PARENT_SCOPE)
```

Doesn't work correctly and ${wxWidgets_LIBRARIES}" (in the 2nd line) doesn't return the previous content of the variable.

Then, if I put everything in the same line, I still can't build GD as it fails on the very first wxwidgets' include...

data.title: Change animation speed scale of a sprite object
data.body:
Add an action to change the animation speed scale of a sprite object and an expression to retrieve the speed scale.
There is also an example in which the player object accelerates when the player continues pressing the movement keys.

data.title: 7zS.sfx detected as Trojan by ClamAV
data.body:
The anti-virus scanner ClamAV (FOSS) reports that 7zS.sfx is a Trojan, even though they're compiled from source:

/GD-master/Binaries/Output/Release_Linux/7zS.sfx: Win.Trojan.Agent-683032 FOUND
/GD-master/Binaries/Output/Release_Windows/7zS.sfx: Win.Trojan.Agent-683032 FOUND

This is the reference data on the Trojan in ClamAV's database:

Submission-ID: 31754129
Sender: Virus Total
Added: Win.Trojan.Agent-683032
Virus name alias: Trojan.Win32.Swisyn.caaq (Kaspersky)

If you think this is in error, report the False Positive at: http://www.clamav.net/report/report-fp.html

data.title: Fix a memory crash (can't create more wxBitmap) when tiles are re-generated if the tileset contains a lot of tiles
data.body:
To display the tiles inside the tilemap editor, the extension was creating a wxBitmap for each tiles when the TileSet::Generate() method was called. It appears that it can cause crash when there are a lot of tiles (wxBitmap functions failling without any visible problem).

To solve this issue, there is now only one wxBitmap containing the whole tileset. In the editors, the wxDC::Blit method is used (with a wxMemoryDC containing the tileset wxBitmap) to display tiles instead of individual wxBitmaps.

(Need testing)

data.title: Disable wxwidgets' assertions to remove locale errors
Use C++11
data.body:
GDevelop (and native games) now uses C++11.
Boost was removed in favor of C++11 features and the official compiler on Windows is now TDM-GCC 4.9.2.

data.title: Use TDM-GCC 4.9.2 (windows), wxWidgets 3.0.2 on Windows, enable C++11, remove Boost
data.body:
- use TDM-GCC 4.9.2 on Windows : (better) C++11 support, can compile with 4 threads to reduce compilation duration (can't achieve that with 4.5.2)
- wxWidgets 3.0.2 on Windows
- enable C++11 to use std::unordered_set/map and std::shared/weak_ptr instead of their Boost equivalent.
- remove Boost (and add a function to put a string to uppercase)

Save more than 60 Mo for the end user (boost headers) and 400 Mo for a dev (boost folder)

TDM-GCC 4.9.2 : http://sourceforge.net/projects/tdm-gcc/files/TDM-GCC%20Installer/tdm-gcc-4.9.2.exe/download
wxWidgets 3.0.2 for Windows : https://www.mediafire.com/folder/f34xy126y11i4/GDevelop

This PR still need testing (I've already made some tests, everything should be working fine) and we need to find a way to remove the libPNG warnings (bash script ?). 
Article about how to remove ICCP profile from PNG : http://www.app-v.be/citrix/how-to-remove-icc-profile-information-from-png-images-from-web-interface

data.title: Ported PrimitiveDrawing to JS platform
OBS support (build package for Fedora/Opensuse and ArchLinux) + Linux integration improvements
data.body:
Here is a PR that adds support for the OpenSUSE Build Service (sorry the big amount of commits compared to the real changes, had some problems with Travis CI so have to push to test).

Detailed changed : 
- Disabled RPATH on Linux (strictly forbidden in rpms, only activated with building tests so as they can find GD's libs on Travis-CI)
- Allow GDevelop to compile with the wxWidgets versions using std containers (on OpenSUSE for example).
- Put linux specific files in /Binaries/Packaging/linux-extra-files (and add their installation in IDE/CMakeLists.txt)
- Fix gdevelop.desktop which has some problems (invalid version, icon with a path), recreated the linux icon in a svg, icons installed in /usr/share/icons/hicolor (both scalable and fixed png for all main sizes).
- Add a MIME type for GDevelop's projects (and an associated icon) to open project by simply double-clicking on them (and gdevelop.sh and StartGDevelop.sh give their first arg to GDIDE).
- Add .spec to build RPM (Fedora 21, OpenSUSE 13.2, OpenSUSE Tumbleweed), and PKGBUILD to build pkg (for Arch Linux)
- Script to prepare GDevelop in order to send it on OBS (interative script which asks GD version, package revision, branch to use and the changelog). After its execution, the files are available in /Binaries/Packaging/opensuse-build-service/final/. _(You need m4 installed to use it)_
- call find_package(wxWidgets) in ExtLibs in order to use the correct wx-config (and force wx-config-3.0 to be used for Fedora as wx-config doesn't exists)

What needs to be done : 
- Test if built debs are still valid
- Add a post install, post remove and post upgrade script to update the mime database and the icon cache for the deb (already done for the spec and pkgbuild files)
- Find a better way to avoid SFML installation (currently, the build scripts removes the SFML libs after make install)

If you have some questions or suggestions. ;)

Ported TextEntryObject to JS platform
Fix wrong include guard in PathfindingAutomatism.h

data.title: Old Game Develop logos in Ressources folder
data.body: There are some old logos which are outdated in the Ressources folder.

data.title: Improved build process
data.body: External libraries are automatically downloaded (Boost, SFML + prebuilt-wxWidgets on Windows) and SFML is now part of the build process.

data.title: Can't remove tiles of the TileMapObject using right click in pencil mode
data.body: Can't remove tiles of the TileMapObject using right click in pencil mode.

data.title: Build may fail in improved-extlibs-cmakelists
data.body:
Some builds fail because the SFML library is not built before a lib/exe that needs it (when using multiple cores to build like make -j4).
Error message : no target to make libsfml-graphics/audio or ... .so
Maybe you need to link against sfml-graphics instead of libsfml-graphics.so in CMakeLists.txt as now SFML is a part of the project building process.

data.body:
My First PR for documentation.
In textruntimeobject.js for GDJS

data.title: Mac OS X 10.10+ version
data.body:
I did some work on it, but cannot get the build to finish on Yosemite. After fixing all the other errors, the errors still popping up are related to wxwidgets and there my knowledge of linking internals ends ; I would not know how to fix those. Here they are;

https://gist.github.com/tluyben/b7777f0f766bddf93d2a

wxwidgets is the latest (3.0.2 which is included does not actually compile on Yosemite) from git; it compiles fine, for x86_64, but linking (with GD, nothing to do with wxwidgets it seems) just gives these errors.

I think after this hurdle it'll run though; any idea what causes this?

data.title: Do not give the focus to EventEditor when mouse is over it
data.body: This causes problems when using other editors. For instance, when renaming an object using the context menu : when you click on "Rename" (over the event editor, as the objects editor's context menu is sometime a bit out of the object editor), then the focus is immediately given back to the event editor before the user can edit the object's name.
